To check that you have the correct key value for %1$s verify that the value here matches the integrity check value provided by the server:

Removing this account will remove your ability to generate codes, however, it will not turn off 2-factor authentication. This may prevent you from signing into your account.

Before removing:

  • Turn off 2-factor authentication for this account, or
  • Ensure you have an alternate mechanism for generating codes.

Removing this account will remove your ability to generate codes, however, it will not turn off 2-step verification. This may prevent you from signing into your account.

Before removing:

  • Turn off 2-step verification for this account, or
  • Ensure you have an alternate mechanism for generating codes.

PIN lock cannot be disabled in ROOT\'d device.
PIN lock can be disabled if you enable hardware based key encryption
Unable to disable PIN lock, verify your current PIN.
Unable set hardware backed keys for encryption, please try again
Still using hardware keys for encryption

EXPERIMENTAL FEATURE:

Data will be encrypted with encryption keys provided by your device, since keys are stored in hardware which even Android cannot access, its safer in rooted device too.

Important Note:

Due to a bug in Android, changing secure lock settings (enabling or disabling PIN/Password/Pattern/Face locks) resets the hardware backed keys too.

You need to reenter your master password, if you make changes to secure lock settings.

Learn more

EXPERIMENTAL FEATURE:

Your device does not support this feature.

Data will be encrypted with encryption keys provided by your device, since keys are stored in hardware which even Android cannot access, its safer in rooted device too.

Learn more
You have enabled PIN lock, you can disable it if you don\'t need.
Your device is rooted and PIN lock is not set. \n\nSetup PIN lock to disable.

You have enabled Hardware backed keys.

Due to a bug in Android, changing secure lock settings (enabling or disabling PIN/Password/Pattern/Face locks) resets the hardware backed keys too.

Reentering your master password will reinitialize the hardware keys.

Your previous installation was used in non-rooted environment however its rooted now.

All your security related data will be reinitialized which includes stored PIN, master password and hardware backed keys settings.

How to find secret or key ?

In cases if you cannot scan the QR code, you can add an account by information provided by services.

In setup 2 step verification page, you will find a section with text Can\'t can the barcode? or similar text, enter the code provided in that section in the secret/key input field.

Click here to view screen shot for Google Account setup where key is visible.

Your previous installation was used in rooted environment however its non-rooted now.

We need to reinitialize few data to safeguard your data.

Unable to access the data found in your Dropbox account.

There can be two possibilities,

  1. Local master password and master password for Dropbox data is not matching.
  2. Corrupted / invalid data in Dropbox.

Visit below link for the possible fixes.

Error in sync - Password mismatch or Corrupted data

Unable to import your account from Dropbox account.

There can be two possibilities,

  1. Master password you have provided during import is not matching with accounts in Dropbox, try changing your master password available under settings and sync again.
  2. Corrupted / invalid data in Dropbox.

Visit below link for the possible fixes.

Error in sync - Password mismatch or Corrupted data
Click here to view the details

Touch here to import accounts from Google Authenticator.
Could not find your logo? Contact us to add it.

What is 2-Step Verification?

2-Step Verification adds an extra layer of security to your Accounts. With 2-Step Verification, you\'ll protect your account with both your password and your phone

To break into an account with 2-Step Verification, bad guys would not only have to know your username and password, they\'d also have to get a hold of your phone.

How it works?

1. Enter your password
Whenever you sign in to your online accounts you\'ll enter your username and password as usual.

2. Enter a code from your phone
Then, you\'ll be asked for a code from Authenticator Plus app.

Source : http://www.google.com/landing/2step/

How to download beta app?

Change log

Terms of service

Privacy policy

Open source licenses
There was a problem contacting battle.net\'s server. Please check your network settings and try again.

Authenticator Plus does not support restoring existing battle.net accounts. You need to remove any existing setup before setting up Authenticator Plus.


1. Login to www.battle.net//bma

 2. If you are already using any battle.net authenticator, Click 'Remove Authenticator' and follow the steps.

 3. Click the 'Attach Authenticator' under Mobile Authenticator section

 4. Verify your email address in Step 1 and click continue in Step 2

 5. Enter the above displayed serial and code in Step 3
Password changed successfully.\n\nIf you have more than one device, you need to change the password individually in all the devices, since your password is stored only locally.

Accounts which don't follow standard PIN generation (HOTP / TOTP) are experimental accounts.

Once the account setup is done these experimental accounts are similar to other accounts


Service provider for these account might change how the account setup is done, which might break account setup from Authenticator Plus, however already added accounts will continue to work normally.

You have incorrectly typed your PIN %d times. \n\nTry again in %d seconds.
You have incorrectly attempted to unlock the app %d times. After %d more unsuccessful attempts, the app will be reset to factory default and all user data will be lost.
You have incorrectly attempted to unlock the app %d times. The app data will now be reset.
Use this to sync time for all other accounts
Use this to sync time for battle.net accounts

If you press "Sync now", Authenticator Plus will attempt to sync its internal clock with Google or Battle.net servers once. The device\'s Date & Time settings will not be changed.

Authenticator Plus does not transmit any personal data or account information while synchronizing its internal clock with Google servers.

Why this is useful

Authenticator Plus generates 2-step verification codes based on 1) the current time, and 2) a secret number known to the app and the server.

If Authenticator Plus and the server disagree on what time it is, the codes that the app generates may not be accepted when you try to log in.

By default Authenticator Plus uses the device\'s Date & Time settings, and in most cases you will be able to generate valid codes by making sure your time, date, and time zone settings are configured correctly. However, when time mismatches do occur, they can be hard to troubleshoot (especially if you use network-provided time or time zones).
Authenticator Plus\'s internal clock has been adjusted to match the time provided by Google servers. \n\nThe Date & Time settings on this device have not been changed.
Authenticator Plus\'s internal clock has been adjusted to match the time provided by battle.net servers. \n\nThe Date & Time settings on this device have not been changed.
There was a problem contacting Google\'s server. Please check your network settings and try again.

All of your data is protected by your Master Password.

Master password is required for restoring your data and syncing with other devices. 

We recommend writing it down and storing it somewhere very secure.
